root_causes: Script applies additional gating (HidA1ARPIS_dochecks and HidA1ARPIS_flag) that are NOT in the expected logic (expected only to show in test mode). This makes the listing more restrictive than required.
Script uses SELECT IF without TEMPORARY (or other temporary filtering). That permanently subsets the dataset rather than producing a temporary listing limited to test-mode cases as expected.
Script assumes OE variable names HidA1ARPIS_1_other ... HidA1ARPIS_5_other; the expected spec does not mandate these exact OE names and they may differ in the real dataset.
instructions: Remove HidA1ARPIS_dochecks and HidA1ARPIS_flag from the selection condition so the listing is gated only by test-mode as specified (isTest()). Example: use TEMPORARY / SELECT IF (qTesting = 1 AND HidA1ARPIS_itemflag = 1) or an equivalent temporary filter that only requires test-mode.

Do not use a permanent SELECT IF. Wrap the listing in TEMPORARY and SEL IF (or use FILTER) so cases are not permanently removed. Example sequence: TEMPORARY. SELECT IF (qTesting = 1 AND HidA1ARPIS_itemflag = 1). LIST ... .

Confirm and use the actual OE variable names in your dataset. If OE variables are named differently (for example HidA1ARPIS1_OE or HidA1ARPIS_1_TEXT), replace HidA1ARPIS_1_other ... HidA1ARPIS_5_other with the real names before running the checks.

Keep the test-mode gating keyed to the actual isTest indicator in your project. If your project uses a different variable than qTesting (value=1 for test), change qTesting to that variable to exactly implement the expected isTest() entry condition.

If HidA1ARPIS_dochecks and HidA1ARPIS_flag are project-required controls, document that dependency explicitly. Otherwise remove them so the script implements the expected logic of showing only in test mode.
